events.name: Cloud Study Jam "Baseline: Deploy & Develop"
events.description:
Cloud Study Jam is a hands-on workshop that will take place on 30 September 2019 (Monday) at 18:00 in Nuremberg, Germany. At the jam the participants can learn the basics of the cloud computing using the Google Cloud Platform (GCP). Our ambitious goal is to complete the "Baseline: Deploy & Develop" quest (https://www.qwiklabs.com/quests/37), which consists of 12 hands-on labs, using the QwikLabs learning platform. During the workshop we'll try to complete the first 6 labs of the quest and the last 6 labs can be completed by every participant on their own after the workshop at home.

All workshop participants will be provided with one FREE month of full access to the QwikLabs learning platform, where also many other labs are available. Upon the successful completion of the "Baseline: Deploy & Develop" quest you will earn a BADGE and one more FREE month of access to QwikLabs will be enabled.

If you are completely new to the Cloud Study Jams and missed the initial meetup in August 2019, don't worry! Come by and start with a simpler quest, called "GCP Essentials" (https://www.qwiklabs.com/quests/23)! If you are a PRO and our basic labs are peanuts for you, don't worry either! Come by and choose any other QwikLabs quest to solve! You'll still get your FREE access to QwikLabs!

Instruction languages: English or German.

What to bring with you? Bring your LAPTOP together with a POWER SUPPLY!

Agenda:
18:00 Welcome & introduction round
18:10 Initial networking & socializing
18:30 Lab 1: "Google Cloud SDK: Qwik Start - Redhat/Centos" (30 minutes)
19:00 Lab 2: "App Engine: Qwik Start - Python / Go / Java / PHP / Ruby" (20 minutes)
19:20 Lab 3: "Cloud Source Repositories: Qwik Start" (30 minutes)
19:50 Break & Networking
20:10 Lab 4: "Container-Optimized OS: Qwik Start" (30 minutes)
20:40 Lab 5: "Datastore: Qwik Start" (30 minutes)
21:10 Lab 6: "Cloud SQL for MySQL/PostgreSQL: Qwik Start" (30 minutes)
21:40 Next Steps & Thank Yous!
22:00 End of the event

This is a completely FREE event. The drinks and snacks will be on us. The good mood and curious mind on you üòä

Check out the impressions of the last Cloud Study Jam in August 2019: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c0rDFR0vO-Q

events.name: ü§ù Joint Meetup: How to Host WordPress on Google Cloud
events.description:
Dear Cloud enthusiasts!

This time we are organizing a joint meetup with the WordPress Nuremberg user group (https://www.meetup.com/Nurnberg-WordPress-Meetup/). WordPress is THE most popular content management system (CMS) on the Internet. The meetup will be held as a workshop, where each participant can learn how to install and run a WordPress instance in a cloud environment. In addition, we'll discuss such topics as scalability, load balancing, regional availability, etc.

Agenda:
19:00 Welcome & introduction round
19:20 Lab 1: "A Tour of Qwiklabs and the Google Cloud Platform" (40 minutes)
20:00 Break
20:20 Lab 2: "Running WordPress on App Engine Flexible Environment" (40 minutes)
21:00 Discussions & Networking
22:00 End of the event

Both labs will be conducted by our trainer using the Qwiklabs (https://google.qwiklabs.com/) learning platform. Every single step will be clearly explained and if necessary discussed. WordPress will be installed in a real Google Cloud environment (no simulation).

EACH PARTICIPANT has the opportunity to bring along his own laptop and carry out both labs on site! Anyone who chooses to do so, will get 1 month FREE access to the Qwiklabs learning platform ($55 value), where you can solve many more labs and quests and by doing so unlock a 2nd free month of Qwiklabs access.

The event will take place as part of the Cloud Study Jam campaign - a series of hands-on workshops on various Google Cloud technologies. The workshop requires no prior knowledge, all steps will be explained in a simple and understandable way.

This is a completely FREE event. The drinks and snacks will be on us. The good mood and curious mind on you üòä

This event is cross-posted in the WordPress usergroup here: https://www.meetup.com/Nurnberg-WordPress-Meetup/events/256604764/ Feel free to RSVP your attendance with both groups: with our group here and with the WordPress usergroup.

Check out the impressions of our Cloud Study Jam in September 2019: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s2dCt34vmgs

IF YOU CAN'T ATTEND THE MEETUP IN PERSON, no worries! We'll broadcast the instructions in our Slack channel #cloudstudyjams on the same day! Make sure to join our Slack workspace using the following link: http://bit.ly/GCDGNbgSlack

Feel free to follow us on Social Media üëç:

events.name: Online Self-Paced Workshop "Kubernetes in the Google Cloud"
events.description:
On 23-January-2020 at 6 PM we'll have our first ever ONLINE self-paced workshop (aka Cloud Study Jam) with the topic "Kubernetes in the Google Cloud". The workshop will take place in our Slack workspace, which you can join here: https://gdgcloudnbg.slack.com (first timers should use the link: http://bit.ly/GCDGNbgSlack ).

We'll use the Qwiklabs learning platform to complete the following
5 labs:

1. "Introduction to Docker" (regular time: 1 hour)
2. "Kubernetes Engine: Qwik Start" (regular time: 30 minutes)
3. "Orchestrating the Cloud with Kubernetes" (regular time: 1 hour 15 minutes)
4. "Managing Deployments Using Kubernetes Engine" (regular time: 1 hour)
5. "Continuous Delivery with Jenkins in Kubernetes Engine" (regular time: 1 hour 15 minutes)

The labs can be also completed after the online meetup. Everyone who completes all the 5 labs will unlock the "Kubernetes in the Google Cloud" badge. More details about the quest "Kubernetes in the Google Cloud" can be found at https://google.qwiklabs.com/quests/29

Every participant of the online meetup will be provided a FREE Qwiklabs code worth of $55, which will enable the access to the Qwiklabs learning platform for 1 month. After completion of any quest the free access will be prolonged by another 1 month.

Join the online workshop on 23-January-2020 at 6 PM using this link: https://gdgcloudnbg.slack.com (first timers should use the link: http://bit.ly/GCDGNbgSlack ).

events.name: Women Techmakers Community Kick Off (IWD)
events.description:
We are inviting people of any gender to participate at our first ever initiation event (online) of the newly created Women Techmakers (WTM) group in Nuremberg! Together we'll celebrate this year's International Women's Day and discuss the main principles and goals of the group! Our very special guest and speaker at the event will be diversity expert Sonya Barlow from UK!

Agenda:
18:00-18:15 Welcome and introduction of participants
18:15-18:45 Speech by Sonya Barlow on diversity
18:45-19:10 Open discussion by all participants about diversity, own experiences, this group's organizational matter...
19:10-19:30 Discussion initiated by our member Dennise Cepeda about media portrayal of women in technology ‚ÄúMiss[tech] representation‚Äù (open end)

We are planning to record the whole session and share it later on our YouTube channel. If anyone doesn't want to be recorded, please let the organizers know it and we'll try our best to remove those parts.

We will use the open source video conferencing tool Jitsi.org that works the best in Chrome browser (will ask to install a plugin - please allow it). The link to the conference call is https://meet.jit.si/wtmnuremberg

Our speaker Sonya Barlow is the founder of LMF Network CiC, a global community dedicated to reducing inequalities and providing a foundation to succeed to women and underrepresented individuals through life skills workshops, digital training, a supportive community and access to expertise for everyone. She is also the founder of her own diversity consultancy and specializes in consulting on inclusive cultures, change management and confidence in the workplace. Sonya is valued for her public speaking skills, which includes delivering two TEDxTalks, facilitating workshops for the likes of General Assembly and delivering key notes across European conferences. Sonya has been recognised as a Rising Star (2017); UK Tech Business Woman of the Year Finalist (2018), Winner of Pitchfanzine (2019) and TechWomen200 finalist (2019). She is passionate about enabling inclusive cultures, educating on life skills and empowering confidence in all to achieve personal success. Her Ted talk is now on YouTube titled "Failures come before Resilience".
https://twitter.com/sonyabarlowuk
https://www.linkedin.com/in/sonyabarlow/

If you have any ideas about topics of the following meetups or want to speak at one, please reach out to the organizers. Any suggestions are very welcome!

Connect with WTM Nuremberg on social media:
https://twitter.com/WTMNuremberg
https://www.instagram.com/wtmnuremberg/
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLFctAbtoOGxjKcy1VWK42w
https://www.linkedin.com/company/women-techmakers-nuremberg/

events.name: The Things Virtual Conference (LoRaWAN & IoT)
events.description:
Welcome to the virtual edition of the world's largest LoRaWAN Conference - "The Things Virtual Conference"! Thanks to our community leads Karen & Vladislav, who are official evangelists of this conference and the LoRaWAN technology, our group members and guests are getting FREE ACCESS ($25 value) to this outstanding Internet of Things (IoT) conference!

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-
ACT NOW and GET YOUR FREE TICKET here: https://thethingsvirtualconference.eventbrite.com?discount=SPECIAL-INVITE
-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-

What is LoRaWAN? It is a network on top of the low-power wide-area wireless "LoRa" (LOng RAnge) technology that uses license-free sub-gigahertz radio frequency bands. In simple words, it is like your WLAN but with much bigger range! LoRaWAN provides a great network fabric for the Internet of Things cases, like geolocation and so on.

This virtual conference is a 24-hour long marathon! It will start on 16-April-2020 at 09:00 am (CEST) and will last up until 17-April-2020 at 09:00 am (CEST).

The AGENDA of the conference is available here: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Jpo3vtlQoB3XB3sg9wjIJoKKa8lEI3lM/view

This free online training is a part of the Speedrun Challenge. A Speedrun is a game based on the Qwiklabs learning platform that contains different labs. events.name: Free Online Accelerated Mobile Pages (AMP) Workshop
events.description:
*** Please, join the conference call using this link: https://meet.google.com/tgm-uuzj-uvk ***

Welcome to the free online Accelerated Mobile Pages (AMP) workshop (aka AMP Study Jam)!

AMP is an open-source custom web development framework created to speed up the loading time of web pages on mobile devices.

AMP can help you create fast websites more quickly! In many ways, the Internet is the central hub for the world. Every day, more people from all over the world access information online. But many don‚Äôt use the Internet on lightning-fast connections or high-powered devices. When websites are developed only for the fastest connections and devices, the experience of many users suffers.

If you‚Äôre an experienced web developer, you can create rich, fast sites with less code. If you‚Äôre a new web developer, AMP helps you learn web development. If you know some HTML and CSS, you can use AMP to make an interactive website!

Preliminary agenda:
6:00pm: Welcome
6:15pm: AMP Introduction by Ben Morss, AMP Developer Advocate at Google
6:30pm: Q&A with Ben Morss
6:45pm: Workshop "Web Development with AMP" by Ben Morss, AMP Developer Advocate at Google
7:45pm: Summary & wrap up
8:00pm: Event ends

*** Please, join the conference call using this link: https://meet.google.com/tgm-uuzj-uvk ***

Anthos is an open hybrid and multi-cloud application platform that enables you to modernize your existing applications, build new ones, and run them anywhere in a secure manner. Built on open source technologies pioneered by Google ‚Äî including Kubernetes, Istio, and Knative ‚Äî Anthos enables consistency between on-premises and cloud environments and helps accelerate application development.

In this live 45-minute webinar you will learn how the newest Anthos features will help you to build resilient applications and enable you to follow Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) and security best practices with ease. We‚Äôll discuss how to use Anthos with more workloads, such as virtual machines and traditional applications, and across more cloud environments.

Speaker: Dan Ciruli, Sr. Product Manager, Google Cloud

*** ATTENTION! To attend this webinar, please register here: https://cloudonair.withgoogle.com/events/multi-cloud-anthos ***

During the webinar, feel free to join our group's slack space to discuss the matters with our community members and organizers: http://bit.ly/GDGCloudNbgSlack

events.description:

A Speedrun is a game based on the Qwiklabs learning platform that contains different labs. A player needs to complete all labs as fast as they can in order to score points to make their way up in the leaderboard. A player can try each lab up to five times.

The Community Speedrun Challenge has four Speedruns that take place in May. Each Speedrun is open for a week and each Speedrun kicks off with a webinar by a Google trainer on Monday evening. Players can decide on which/how many Speedruns they want to participate.

With each Speedrun session there is a webinar connected with a trainer that guides through the first lab, the players have a certain amount of time to complete all labs.

Topics:
- [4-May-2020] Baseline: Data, ML, AI
- [11-May-2020] Intro to ML: Language Processing (this event!)
- [18-May-2020] Intermediate ML
- [25-May-2020] BigQuery for Machine Learning

events.name: Free Self-Paced Workshop: Deploying Applications in Google Cloud (online)
events.description:
On 14-May-2020 at 6 PM (CEST) we'll run an ONLINE self-paced workshop (aka Cloud Study Jam) with the topic "Deploying Applications in Google Cloud". The workshop will take place in our Slack workspace, which you can join here: https://bit.ly/GDGCloudNbgSlack

We'll use the Qwiklabs learning platform to complete 5 labs.

The labs can be also completed after the online meetup. Everyone who completes all 5 labs will unlock the "Deploying Applications" badge. More details about the quest "Deploying Applications" can be found at https://google.qwiklabs.com/quests/26

Every participant of the online meetup will be provided a FREE Qwiklabs coupon code worth of $55, which will enable the access to the Qwiklabs learning platform for 1 month. After completion of the quest the free access will be prolonged by another 1 month.

Participants that are NEW to Qwiklabs or Google Cloud are encouraged to complete the FREE lab "A Tour of Qwiklabs and the Google Cloud Platform" BEFORE the beginning of the workshop: https://www.qwiklabs.com/focuses/2794?parent=catalog

Besides badges, we'll hand out digital "certificates of completion" to everyone who will complete the quest within 7 days after the beginning of the study jam! More about it in the follow up emails...

Join the online workshop on 14-May-2020 at 6 PM (CEST) using this link: https://bit.ly/GDGCloudNbgSlack

events.name: Migrating to Google Cloud Platform - Online Course
events.description:
*** ATTENTION! To attend this online course, please register here: https://cloudonair.withgoogle.com/events/noram-may-cloudonboard ***

Learn what it takes to migrate to Google Cloud Platform (GCP) from start to finish. Beginning with assessing your source environment and ending with governance insights, you'll watch expert-led sessions and demos, then track your progress with short quizzes at the end of each section.

Agenda:
6:00pm-6:20pm What is GCP?
6:20pm-6:40pm Assessing the Source Environment
7:00pm-7:20pm GCP Fundamentals
7:20pm-7:40pm Virtual Machines and Networks in the Cloud
8:00pm-8:20pm Migrate for Compute Engine
8:20pm-8:40pm Governance
9:00pm-9:30pm Cloud Hero

Presenter: Jasen Baker, Cloud Platform Instructor at Google Cloud.

events.name: Google Kubernetes Engine - Online Course
events.description:
*** ATTENTION! To attend this online course, please register here: https://cloudonair.withgoogle.com/events/noram-may-cloudonboard ***

Explore the possibilities of Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) on Google Cloud Platform. Start with single-click clusters, then move on to advanced cluster management, managing containers at scale, and the power of combining GKE with other innovations. Watch expert-led sessions and demos, then test out your new knowledge with short quizzes.

Agenda:
6:00pm-6:15pm What is GCP Kubernetes Engine?
6:15pm-6:30pm Cluster Orchestration with GKE
6:30pm-6:45pm Kubernetes on Google Cloud
7:00pm-7:15pm Workloads on GKE
7:15pm-7:30pm Securing Workloads
7:30pm-7:45pm Managing the GKE Environment
7:45pm-8:00pm Preparing a Google Kubernetes Engine Environment for Production
8:00pm-8:15pm Continuous Integration and Delivery
8:15pm-8:45pm Cloud Hero

upcoming.name: Sundar Challenge - 30-June-2020 - Grand Final
upcoming.description:
The Sundar Challenge encourages everyone to complete as many Qwiklabs quests as possible in the time from 30-April-2020 to 30-June-2020. The minimal amount of quests that needs to be completed to successfully participate in the challenge is 5! 10 people who will solve the most amount of quests will be awarded with special winner certificates. All eligible participants (5 solved quests or more) will receive from us certificates of completion!

Registration for the Sundar Challenge is open, please fill out this registration form: https://forms.gle/C8hi6gWF8n3PPnxB8

If you have further questions or want to participate in the discussion with other members, please feel free to join our Slack space here: https://bit.ly/GDGCloudNbgSlack

Qwiklabs.com is a learning platform, where participants can practice and experiment with real cloud environments. The Google Cloud Developers group Nuremberg ("GDG Cloud Nuremberg") runs weekly free Cloud Study Jams. At study jams our members are receiving a free Qwiklabs 1 month subscription (can be extended by another free month), which allows the members to solve any amount of Qwiklabs labs and quests. Membership in the GDG Cloud Nuremberg group is free and available to everyone.

The Sundar Challenge is named after our member Sundar who came up with the idea of this contest. For those, who are curious to learn how the challenge was initiated, watch this entertaining 17 mins video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yfmOwXow3UU
